title.narrative: Alta Semper Ilera Fund I Limited

description.narrative:
Project Outcomes - Stakeholders: Access to growth capital for fund investees. The Fund will provide access to growth capital companies in Africa. The Fund will mobilize additional capital through co-investments. - Stakeholders: Increased Investee Growth. The Manager is expected to add value to companies through various strategies such as institutionalization of family businesses, restructuring, operational improvements, governance and financial engineering, to generate economies of scale. - Stakeholders: Access to higher quality health services for customers/patients. Africa has large unmet demand for quality healthcare, which the Fund aims to address.
Contribution to Market Creation: - Competitiveness: Increased PE Market Activity. IFC anticipates the Fund, through an increase in PE investment levels, will improve competitiveness by demonstrating the viability and growth potential of companies targeting the rising middle class in Africa and sectors benefitting from its growth.

The proposed project consists of an equity investment of up to US$15.5 million in Alta Semper Ilera Fund I, L.P. (Alta Semper or the Fund), a 10-year private equity fund targeting to raise US$250 million. The Fund will obtain controlling stakes in leading healthcare and consumer companies by way of equity investments. The Fund will have a pan-African focus and make equity investments of between US$10 and US$50 million per transaction.

name.narrative: The Fund is an exempted limited partnership registered under the laws of Mauritius. Alta Semper team is based in London, UK; Lagos, Nigeria; and Cairo, Egypt. The Fund will primarily target to invest in Ivory Coast, Nigeria, Ghana, Senegal, Morocco, Egypt, Tunisia, Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda and Mozambique.
